README.html.title: Refinity | Refinity
README.html.keywords: Refinity Welcome to Refinity, a comprehensive C# library designed to boost developer productivity. Our library is packed with a wide range of extension methods, each crafted to streamline your coding experience and enhance your projects. Features Wide Range of Extension Methods: Covering various aspects of C# programming to make your code more efficient and readable. Easy Integration: Seamlessly integrates with existing C# projects, requiring minimal setup. High-Quality Code: Written with best practices in mind, ensuring reliability and performance. Regular Updates: Continuously evolving with new methods and improvements based on community feedback. Installation To use Refinity in your project, follow these steps: Add the Refinity package to your project via NuGet: dotnet add package Refinity Import the library in your C# files: Usage Refinity is designed to be intuitive. Here’s a quick example of how you can use one of the extension methods: Math using Refinity.Math; int a = 10; a.Fibonacci(); // 55 Finance using Refinity.Math; using Refinity.Finance; double start = 1020.0; double end = 1000.0; double difference = start.DifferencePercentage(end); // 2 string diffString = difference.ToStringPercentage(); // "2,00%" License Refinity is released under the MIT License. See the LICENSE file for more details. Contact For support or queries, reach out to us on this GitHub Repository! Refinity is more than just a library; it’s a tool to empower developers to write better, more efficient code. Join us in making the C# world a more productive place!

Default is ','. Returns DataTable A DataTable containing the data from the CSV file. ConvertCsvToObject<T>(Stream, char, bool) Converts a CSV file to a list of objects of type T. public static List<T> ConvertCsvToObject<T>(Stream stream, char delimiter = ',', bool ignoreCaseHeader = false) Parameters stream Stream The stream containing the CSV data. delimiter char The delimiter used to separate values in the CSV file. Default is ','. ignoreCaseHeader bool If true, the header is case insensitive. Default is false. Returns List<T> A list of objects of type T. Type Parameters T The type of objects to convert to. ConvertTextToCSV(string, char, char, string[]?) Converts a text file to a CSV file. public static byte[] ConvertTextToCSV(string pathToTxt, char delimiter = ',', char saveDelimiter = ',', string[]? headers = null) Parameters pathToTxt string The path to the input text file. delimiter char The character used to separate values in the text file. Default is ','. saveDelimiter char The character used to separate values in the CSV file. Default is ','. headers string[] Returns byte[] True if the conversion is successful, false otherwise. ConvertToBase64(string) Converts a file to a Base64 string representation. public static string ConvertToBase64(string path) Parameters path string The path of the file to convert. Returns string The Base64 string representation of the file.
